column4: shall any brave knights harken to the cry, and join in the quest for a lost cd-rom drive damsel in distress?
has this always been this way?

son of king jammys, nay.  had probably with previous gutsy install.  reinstalled for multiple reasons, including, aye, that festering wound.  that reinstall was thus performed from said drive, whence i could perform boot ups.  alas, after the install and the repository download upgrade, the fair cd-rom drive, she disappeared and i have wept ever since.
do -->    grep cdrom /etc/fstab  and paste output here
son of king jamys, i shall instead post to a pastebin server as i write from the alternate machine next door
ok, should only be one line
paste.ubuntu-nl.org/56371
mmm that line differs in no way from mine except for the exec option
you have two drives?
and what happens when you type    mount /media/cdrom0   (with a cd in the drive)
no error message, nothing?
at last a response.  "mount: no medium found."
mount /media/cdrom1
have cds in both drives so we can eliminate that
interesting
and you had inserted a blank cd?
hardware problem is possible - i don't see anything wrong with your setup otherwise - but i'm not an expert
thanks.  any other opinions?  and what of the "exec" line in my fstab?
if you want to mess with that, you could (don't delete the original lines, just put a # at the beginning)
things to try would be: a) remove exec b)remove one of the lines and keep scd0 only
yw, let us know if it got fixed and how
